node.title: Myanmar court sentences ousted leader Suu Kyi to four years in prison
node.alt: A close-up file photo of Myanmar's leader Aung San Suu Kyi dated December 2019.
node.description: A court in Myanmar sentencesÂ the country's ousted leader, Aung San Suu Kyi, to four years in prison after finding her guilty of incitement and violating coronavirus restrictions.
node.content:
["A court in Myanmar has sentenced the country's ousted leader, Aung San Suu Kyi, to four years in prison after finding her guilty of incitement and violating coronavirus restrictions, a legal official says.", "The incitement case involved statements posted on her party's Facebook page after she and other party leaders had already been detained by the military.", "The coronavirus charge involved a campaign appearance ahead of elections, which her party overwhelmingly won,\u00a0in November last year.", "The army, which saw its allied party lose\u00a0many seats in the election, claimed massive voting fraud, but independent election observers did not detect any major irregularities.", "The court's ruling was conveyed by a legal official who insisted on anonymity for fear of being punished by the authorities.", "Ms Suu Kyi's trials are closed to the media and spectators, and her lawyers, who had been the sole source of information on the proceedings, were served with gag orders in October forbidding them from releasing information.", "The cases against Ms Suu Kyi are widely seen as contrived to discredit her and keep her from running in the next election.", "Myanmar's constitution bars anyone sent to prison after being convicted of a crime from holding high office or becoming an MP.", "", "
Activists say the junta's forces have killed more than 1,000 people since the coup in February.(Reuters)
", "Opposition to military rule in Myanmar remains strong 10 months after the army's takeover, and the verdict may inflame tensions even further.", "There were protest marches on Sunday, with demonstrators voicing their opposition to the military government and calling for the release of Ms Suu Kyi and other detained members of her government.", "An army truck deliberately sped into a march by about 30 young people in Yangon, the country's biggest city, and at least three of the protesters may have been killed, according to unconfirmed reports.", "
Former president Win Myint also jailed
", "The verdicts in Ms Suu Kyi's cases were supposed to be delivered last Tuesday.", "However, the court postponed its ruling, with no explanation.", "At the same time, it agreed to allow testimony this week on a separate coronavirus charge from an additional defence witness who had previously been unable to attend court because of ill health.", "Ms Suu Kyi's lawyers sought vigorously to have the incitement charge dismissed.", "The prosecution's evidence consisted of statements posted on a Facebook page belonging to\u00a0Ms Suu Kyi's party.", "Defence lawyers argued that Ms Suu Kyi and a co-defendant, former president Win Myint, could not be held responsible for the statements,\u00a0which criticised the military takeover and suggested in broad terms that it be resisted,\u00a0because they were already in detention.", "The former mayor of Naypyitaw, Myo Aung, was another defendant in the case, which carries a maximum penalty of two years in prison and a fine.", "Win Myint was sentenced to a total of four years and Myo Aung to two years.", "February's seizure of power by the army was met by nationwide non-violent demonstrations, which security forces quashed with deadly force.", "They have since killed about 1,300 civilians, according to a detailed tally compiled by the Assistance Association for Political Prisoners.", "AP"]
